nodes.mouseover: Karachi is the largest city in the south, with more than 16.6 million people. It has been marked by ethnic conflict and violence. Karachi was the capital of Pakistan from 1843 to 1958, when it moved to Rawalpindi.
The Himalayas divide South Asia from China. They reach into northern Pakistan.
Pakistan's capital Islamabad is relatively small, with a population of less than 1.4 million people. It is one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Pakistan.
Faisalabad has a population of about 3.5 million.
Lahore is the city where Pakistani independence was declared. It is the cultural epicenter of Pakistan.
The Karakoram Range is an icy mountain range with the most glaciers outside of the arctic. K2, the second highest peak in the world, is in this range.
The Indus River is a key water resource for Pakistan's agricultural production and is the main potable water supply for Pakistan.
